translation: "When it comes to the body, what passes through the body as good, fine, and soft can have the five aggregates and habits in it, which pass through birth-and-death, cause immovability to fall into the path, and cause those who don't shut it off to fall into sin; what passes through the body as medium, fine, and soft has the five aggregates and habits in it, which pass through birth-and-death, cause immovability to fall into the path, and cause those who don't shut it off to fall into sin; and what passes through the body as harsh, hard, painful, and unacceptable has the five aggregates and habits in it, which pass through birth-and-death, cause immovability to fall into the path, and cause those who don't shut it off to fall into sin."

source_sentence: 佛言：「菩薩行要當關令不動，動者為未解。」
translation: The Buddha said, "A bodhisattva's practice must be to keep the barrier immovable, for those who move are those who have yet to understand."

source_sentence: 諸菩薩報佛言：「我曹當坐禪令不動。」
translation: The bodhisattvas reported to the Buddha, "We will sit in meditation and cause them not to move."

source_sentence: 佛問諸菩薩言：「禪已復動不？」
translation: The Buddha asked the bodhisattvas, "Will it move again after meditation?"

source_sentence: 諸菩薩報佛言：「禪覺復動。」
translation: The bodhisattvas reported to the Buddha, saying, "The meditation and awakening move again."

source_sentence: 佛問諸菩薩：「何以故復動？」
translation: The Buddha asked the bodhisattvas, "Why is it that it's still moving?"

source_sentence: 諸菩薩言：「自然動。」
translation: The bodhisattvas said, "It naturally moves."

source_sentence: 佛問諸菩薩：「何以故自然動？」
translation: The Buddha asked the bodhisattvas, "Why does it naturally move?"

source_sentence: 諸菩薩言：「我不解，不知從何因緣動？」
translation: The bodhisattvas say, "I don't understand, and I don't know from what causes and conditions I'm moved."

source_sentence: 佛言：「如是諸菩薩尚未解。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Thus, the bodhisattvas haven't understood it yet."

source_sentence: 諸菩薩言：「願佛當復為我解。」
translation: The bodhisattvas said, "May the Buddha again understand it for me."

source_sentence: 佛言：「菩薩所以禪自然動覺者，菩薩有百八關生，動不動不止故。」
translation: The Buddha said, "The reason a bodhisattva's meditation naturally moves and awakens is because bodhisattvas have 108 barriers to birth that don't stop moving."

source_sentence: 佛說如是，諸菩薩皆稽首受行。
translation: When the Buddha said this, the bodhisattvas all bowed their heads and accepted the teaching.

source_sentence: 佛言：「菩薩如是尚未應解。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Thus, the bodhisattvas have yet to understand."

source_sentence: 諸菩薩言：「何以故復未解？」
translation: The bodhisattvas said, "Why is it that you still haven't understood it?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「但坐菩薩有本，不止守百八行故。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Only sitting bodhisattvas have roots, so they don't just observe the 108 practices."

source_sentence: 諸菩薩皆稽首言：「願佛當復為我解。」
translation: The bodhisattvas all bowed their heads and said, "May the Buddha again explain this for me."

source_sentence: 佛言：「菩薩心本多所念，不止守故，心本罪百八行。
translation: The Buddha said, "The bodhisattva's mind is originally full of mindfulness, so it's not just guarding the one hundred and eight practices that are originally a sin in the mind.

source_sentence: 「轉入意，意本多所念，不止守故，意本罪百八行。
translation: "He turns to mind, which is originally full of mindfulness and doesn't merely guard it, and it's originally a sin of 108 deeds.

source_sentence: 「轉入識，識本多所念，不止守故，識本罪百八行。
translation: "He's turned into consciousness, which is originally full of mindfulness and not merely guarded, resulting in the 108 original sins of consciousness.

source_sentence: 「轉入眼，眼本多所見好色，不止守故，眼本罪百八行；眼本多所見中色，不止守故，眼本罪百八行；眼本多所見惡色，不止守故，眼本罪百八行。
translation: "When it's turned into the eye, the eye originally sees many good forms that are more than guarded, which is a hundred and eight violations of the eye's original sin; the eye originally sees many medium forms that are more than guarded, which is a hundred and eight violations of the eye's original sin; and the eye originally sees many bad forms that are more than guarded, which is a hundred and eight violations of the eye's original sin.

source_sentence: 「轉入耳，耳本多所聞好聲，不止守故，耳本罪百八行；耳本多所聞中聲，不止守故，耳本罪百八行；耳本多所聞惡聲，不止守故，耳本罪百八行。
translation: "Turning to the ear, the ear originally hears a lot of good sounds, which are more than guarded, and the ear originally commits 108 crimes; the ear originally hears a lot of middling sounds, which are more than guarded, and the ear originally commits 108 crimes; the ear originally hears a lot of bad sounds, which are more than guarded, and the ear originally commits 108 crimes.

source_sentence: 「轉入鼻，鼻本多所聞好香，不止守故，鼻本罪百八行；鼻本多所聞中香，不止守故，鼻本罪百八行；鼻本多所聞惡臭，不止守故，鼻本罪百八行。
translation: "Turning to the nose, the nose itself mostly hears nice smells, which are more than guarded, resulting in 108 violations of the nose root; the nose itself mostly hears middling smells, which are more than guarded, resulting in 108 violations of the nose root; and the nose itself mostly hears bad smells, which are more than guarded, resulting in 108 violations of the nose root.

source_sentence: 「轉入口，口本多所得美味好語言，不止守故，口本罪百八行；口本多所得中味中語言，不止守故，口本罪百八行；口本多所得惡味惡語言，不止守故，口本罪百八行。
translation: "When they turn to the mouth, the mouth itself is full of delicious speech that's more than guarded, which is a 108-percent offense; the mouth itself is full of medium tastes and medium speech that's more than guarded, which is a 108-percent offense; and the mouth itself is full of bad tastes and bad speech that's more than guarded, which is a 108-percent offense.

source_sentence: 「轉入身，身本多所得好細軟可身，不止守故，身本罪百八行；身本多所得中細軟，不止守故，身本罪百八行；身本多所得惡麁堅苦痛不可身，不止守故，身本罪百八行。」
translation: "When they turn to the body, the good, fine, and soft body that they used to get is more than just a guard, which is a hundred and eight violations of the original sin; the medium, fine, and soft body that they used to get is more than just a guard, which is a hundred and eight violations of the original sin; and the harsh, hard, painful, and unacceptable body that they used to get is more than just a guard, which is a hundred and eight violations of the original sin."

source_sentence: 佛說如是，諸菩薩皆歡喜受行。
translation: When the Buddha said this, the bodhisattvas all rejoiced and accepted it as practice.

source_sentence: 大方等大集經卷第五十九
translation: Dafangdengdaji jing, vol. 59

source_sentence: 此經自下二卷，則丹藏所無，故今無可相校；而宋、鄉二本，此卷之中皆有三節之文，文斷義絕，難取解處。
translation: In the Song and Xiang versions of the sutra, there are three sections of text in this volume, which cut off the meaning and make it difficult to grasp the meaning.

source_sentence: 第一、第九幅十七行云：有五陰中有之下(便云)所多得中味中語言等；第二、第十幅二十一行云：言相未具者自不之下(便云)習自言我無罪等；第三、第十二幅二行云：是為顛倒口之下(便云)能得佛何能使人得佛，是為三節文斷處也。
translation: First, the seventeenth line of the ninth panel reads, "There are five aggregates in which existence is subordinate (then it's said) to that which is abundant in taste, speech, and so forth; second, the twenty-first line of the tenth panel reads, "It's not subordinate to those who say their characteristics are not complete (then it's said) to those who are accustomed to saying I'm without fault;" and third, the second line of the twelfth panel reads, "It's subordinate to the mistaken mouth (then it's said) to those who can attain Buddhahood and those who can cause others to attain Buddhahood," and these are the three sections where the text is cut off.

source_sentence: 今准《明度經》，此中二本，皆錯將是為顛倒口之下，所多得中味中語言乃至相未具者自不等凡二十七行，總三百七十九字，進而寫之于五陰中有之下，却將五陰中有之下，習自言我無罪乃至是為顛倒口等凡二十七行，總三百七十六字，退而寫之于相未具者自不之下，致令三節之文文斷義絕。
translation: According to the Mingdu jing, these two texts mistakenly include twenty-seven lines (totaling 379 words) under "This is the mistaken mouth," "What's gained in taste, language, and even those whose characteristics are not fully present," and they furthermore write them under "There are five aggregates," but they include twenty-seven lines (totaling 376 words) under "There are five aggregates," "I say I'm blameless," and "This is the mistaken mouth," and they retreat and write them under "Those whose characteristics are not fully present," which cuts off the meaning of the three sections of the text.

source_sentence: 今依《明度經》進退而正之，又為看舊鄉、宋藏者略錄正文于左：中有五陰中有(便云)習自言我無罪，乃至是為顛倒口(便云)所多得中味中語言，乃至相未具者自不(便云)能得佛，何能使人得佛(云云)？
translation: Now, we'll correct it according to the Mingdu jing by advancing and retreating, and we'll briefly record the text to the left for those who read the old country and Song canons: "Among the five aggregates, there's (then) the habit of saying 'I'm blameless,' and even this is the mistaken speech that attains a medium taste and medium speech, and even this is the characteristic that's not yet complete that doesn't make a person attain Buddhahood, so how can it make a person attain Buddhahood (clouds)?
